title: Hanban provides grant for establishment of Confucius Classroom at Yerevan No. 29 Middle School
description: On December 6, 2016, Yerevan No. 29 Middle School hosted an unveiling ceremony for a Confucius classroom. Funding for the classroom was donated by Hanban Confucius Institute. The school has more than 240 students studying Chinese as a compulsory subject.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Hanban provides grant for establishment of Confucius Classroom at Yerevan No. 29 Middle School

# Description
On December 6, 2016, Yerevan No. 29 Middle School hosted an unveiling ceremony for a Confucius classroom. Funding for the classroom was donated by Hanban Confucius Institute. The school has more than 240 students studying Chinese as a compulsory subject.
justification: Project focuses on educational and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Confucius Classroom, education-focused project, no energy or infrastructure components

title: PRC Poverty Reduction and Regional Cooperation Fund grants $4.95 million USD for 2016 Projects
description: On 24 March 2005, the Chinese Government and Asian Development Bank (ADB) jointly established the People's Republic of China (PRC) Poverty Reduction and Regional Cooperation Fund. The China Ministry of Finance provided financing and ADB implemented the projects. The purpose of this special fund is to support the process of poverty reduction, regional cooperation and knowledge sharing for ADB developing member countries (DMCs) in the Asia-Pacific as well as Greater Mekong Subregion (GMS) and Central Asia Regional Economic Cooperation (CAREC) countries.  According to a 2019 Annual Report (p. 35-36), on 11 July 2016 and 25 October 2016, the Chinese Ministry of Finance approved $3.75 million USD from this special fund for six different Batch 1 projects:  1) $500,000 USD for "Strengthening Water Security in the Aral Sea Basin." Closing date is TBD.  2) $400,000 USD for "Policy Coordination and Planning of Border Economic Zones of the PRC and Viet Nam." Closed 29 March 2019.  3) $1 million USD for "Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program (Tranche 2)." Expected to close 30 June 2023.  4) $650,000 USD for "Strengthening Knowledge Management in Central and West Asia (supplementary)." Closed 15 March 2019. 5) $700,000 USD for "Advancing RCI through BIMP-EAGA and IMT-GT (supplementary)." Closed 6 February 2019.  6) $500,000 USD for "Central Asia Regional Economic Cooperation: Supporting Capacity Development Needs of CAREC 2020 (supplementary)." Expected to close 30 June 2020.   According to a 2019 Annual Report (p. 36), on 27 December 2016, the Chinese Ministry of Finance approved $1.2 million USD from this special fund for two different Batch 2 projects:  1) $500,000 USD for "Promoting Green Local Currency Denominated Bonds for Infrastructure Development ASEAN+3." Closed 30 June 2019.  2) $700,000 USD for "Promoting Low Carbon Development in CAREC Program Cities." Expected to close 31 December 2019.
staff_comments: Also called the PRC Fund or 中华人民共和国减贫与区域合作基金.Not marked as umbrella and did not separate batches 1 and 2 because the risk of duplication is very low.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
PRC Poverty Reduction and Regional Cooperation Fund grants $4.95 million USD for 2016 Projects

# Description
On 24 March 2005, the Chinese Government and Asian Development Bank (ADB) jointly established the People's Republic of China (PRC) Poverty Reduction and Regional Cooperation Fund. The China Ministry of Finance provided financing and ADB implemented the projects. The purpose of this special fund is to support the process of poverty reduction, regional cooperation and knowledge sharing for ADB developing member countries (DMCs) in the Asia-Pacific as well as Greater Mekong Subregion (GMS) and Central Asia Regional Economic Cooperation (CAREC) countries.  According to a 2019 Annual Report (p. 35-36), on 11 July 2016 and 25 October 2016, the Chinese Ministry of Finance approved $3.75 million USD from this special fund for six different Batch 1 projects:  1) $500,000 USD for "Strengthening Water Security in the Aral Sea Basin." Closing date is TBD.  2) $400,000 USD for "Policy Coordination and Planning of Border Economic Zones of the PRC and Viet Nam." Closed 29 March 2019.  3) $1 million USD for "Energy Supply Improvement Investment Program (Tranche 2)." Expected to close 30 June 2023.  4) $650,000 USD for "Strengthening Knowledge Management in Central and West Asia (supplementary)." Closed 15 March 2019. 5) $700,000 USD for "Advancing RCI through BIMP-EAGA and IMT-GT (supplementary)." Closed 6 February 2019.  6) $500,000 USD for "Central Asia Regional Economic Cooperation: Supporting Capacity Development Needs of CAREC 2020 (supplementary)." Expected to close 30 June 2020.   According to a 2019 Annual Report (p. 36), on 27 December 2016, the Chinese Ministry of Finance approved $1.2 million USD from this special fund for two different Batch 2 projects:  1) $500,000 USD for "Promoting Green Local Currency Denominated Bonds for Infrastructure Development ASEAN+3." Closed 30 June 2019.  2) $700,000 USD for "Promoting Low Carbon Development in CAREC Program Cities." Expected to close 31 December 2019.
justification: Primary purpose is poverty reduction and regional cooperation through various social development initiatives
evidence: Focus on poverty reduction, regional cooperation, knowledge sharing, and capacity development across multiple sectors

title: China grants 50 special purpose utility vehicles worth USD 3.1 million to Azeravtoyol in Baku, Azerbaijan
description: On April 11, 2016, as part of an economic and technical cooperation agreement, China granted 50 special purpose utility vehicles worth USD 3.1 million to Azerbaijan. The 50 special purpose utility vehicles worth USD 3.1 million China donated to Azerbaijan was delivered in Baku. The vehicles were manufactured by China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation and granted to Azeravtoyol, the Azerbaijan Ministry of Roads. The vehicles specifically included medium-sized garbage trucks, vacuum trucks, water tankers,and street sweeping machines. It is unclear which specific ETCA the grant came from.  .
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China grants 50 special purpose utility vehicles worth USD 3.1 million to Azeravtoyol in Baku, Azerbaijan

# Description
On April 11, 2016, as part of an economic and technical cooperation agreement, China granted 50 special purpose utility vehicles worth USD 3.1 million to Azerbaijan. The 50 special purpose utility vehicles worth USD 3.1 million China donated to Azerbaijan was delivered in Baku. The vehicles were manufactured by China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation and granted to Azeravtoyol, the Azerbaijan Ministry of Roads. The vehicles specifically included medium-sized garbage trucks, vacuum trucks, water tankers,and street sweeping machines. It is unclear which specific ETCA the grant came from.  .
justification: Project involves donation of utility vehicles for municipal purposes without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Special purpose utility vehicles including garbage trucks, vacuum trucks, water tankers, and street sweeping machines

title: CICETE provides $11 million grant for Educational Equipment Project
description: In 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Azerbaijan signed a grant agreement for the provision of 20,000 laptops, interactive whiteboards, projectors, printers, and other electronic equipment for educational purposes. China International Center for Economic and Technical Exchanges (CICETE) was the source of grant funding and it reportedly committed $11 million in total. The equipment was primarily earmarked for use at the Baku 23rd Middle School (23 saylı tam orta məktəb) in the city of Baku and Azerbaijan National Agricultural University (Azərbaycan Dövlət Aqrar Universiteti) in the district of Ganja. An opening ceremony for the electronic classroom at the Azerbaijan National Agricultural University was held on September 15, 2017. The equipment, according to the Azerbaijan Ministry of Education, was formally handed over on September 19, 2017.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
CICETE provides $11 million grant for Educational Equipment Project

# Description
In 2016, the Chinese Government and the Government of Azerbaijan signed a grant agreement for the provision of 20,000 laptops, interactive whiteboards, projectors, printers, and other electronic equipment for educational purposes. China International Center for Economic and Technical Exchanges (CICETE) was the source of grant funding and it reportedly committed $11 million in total. The equipment was primarily earmarked for use at the Baku 23rd Middle School (23 saylı tam orta məktəb) in the city of Baku and Azerbaijan National Agricultural University (Azərbaycan Dövlət Aqrar Universiteti) in the district of Ganja. An opening ceremony for the electronic classroom at the Azerbaijan National Agricultural University was held on September 15, 2017. The equipment, according to the Azerbaijan Ministry of Education, was formally handed over on September 19, 2017.
justification: Project focuses on educational equipment provision without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Provision of laptops, interactive whiteboards, projectors, and printers for educational purposes at schools and universities

title: Hanban establishes a Confucius Institute at the Azerbaijan University of Languages
description: On November 11, 2015, Hanban agreed to establish a Confucius Institute at the Azerbaijan University of Languages (Азербайджанский университет языков or Azerbaycan Diller Üniversitesi) in the city of Baku. The center opened on June 24, 2016, and a signing ceremony was held on May 24, 2018. The center was established in partnership with Huzhou University. The monetary value of the financial commitment that supported this project is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Hanban establishes a Confucius Institute at the Azerbaijan University of Languages

# Description
On November 11, 2015, Hanban agreed to establish a Confucius Institute at the Azerbaijan University of Languages (Азербайджанский университет языков or Azerbaycan Diller Üniversitesi) in the city of Baku. The center opened on June 24, 2016, and a signing ceremony was held on May 24, 2018. The center was established in partnership with Huzhou University. The monetary value of the financial commitment that supported this project is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on educational and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Confucius Institute for language education and cultural exchange

title: China donated materials worth $19,221 to the Bahamas for the construction of gazebos on the Sandilands Campus of the Therapeutic Environment Project (TEP)
description: On October 21 2016, Chinese Embassy donated materials worth $19,221 to the Bahamas for the construction of gazebos on the Sandilands Campus as part of the Therapeutic Environment Project (TEP). This project conducted work on the Sandilands Rehabilitation Centre. The Gazebos for this project will assist in completing Phase II of the Therapeutic Environment Project which is located at the front lawn of the Cruikshank Ward.
staff_comments: The Bahamas was not ODA eligible in 2016.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donated materials worth $19,221 to the Bahamas for the construction of gazebos on the Sandilands Campus of the Therapeutic Environment Project (TEP)

# Description
On October 21 2016, Chinese Embassy donated materials worth $19,221 to the Bahamas for the construction of gazebos on the Sandilands Campus as part of the Therapeutic Environment Project (TEP). This project conducted work on the Sandilands Rehabilitation Centre. The Gazebos for this project will assist in completing Phase II of the Therapeutic Environment Project which is located at the front lawn of the Cruikshank Ward.
justification: Project involves construction of gazebos for a therapeutic environment at a rehabilitation center, with no direct energy or environmental impact
evidence: Construction of gazebos at Sandilands Rehabilitation Centre as part of Therapeutic Environment Project

title: China donated $50,000 to the Bahamas for the recovery after Hurricane Matthew
description: On October 14th 2016, China donated $50,000 to Bahamas' National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA), for the purpose of assisting with restoration and recovery efforts after Hurricane Matthew. According to ECCO, Chinese Embassy and Chinese funding companies granted $150,000 in total for the recovery of this hurricane.
staff_comments: The Bahamas was not ODA eligible in 2016.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
China donated $50,000 to the Bahamas for the recovery after Hurricane Matthew

# Description
On October 14th 2016, China donated $50,000 to Bahamas' National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA), for the purpose of assisting with restoration and recovery efforts after Hurricane Matthew. According to ECCO, Chinese Embassy and Chinese funding companies granted $150,000 in total for the recovery of this hurricane.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation for disaster recovery with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation for hurricane recovery, no energy or infrastructure components mentioned

title: Chinese Embassy donated $5,000 to Doris Johnson High School Music Programme in the Bahamas
description: On March 23, 2016, the Chinese Embassy presented a $5,000 check to the Doris Johnson High School Band, the recipient of the the donation, to support the school's music programs.
staff_comments: The Bahamas was not ODA eligible in 2016.
combined_text:

EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy donated $5,000 to Doris Johnson High School Music Programme in the Bahamas

# Description

justification: Project is a donation to support education and cultural development, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact

title: China Eximbank provides $405.8 million preferential buyer’s credit for Multi Lane Road Tunnel under River Karnaphuli Project (Linked to Project ID #52873 and #55046) [BRI]
description: On June 9, 2014, the Prime Minister of Bangladesh, Sheikh Hasina, visited China and the Chinese Government and the Government of Bangladesh signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) on the Multi-Lane Road Tunnel under River Karnaphuli Project. Then, on November 14, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Bangladesh signed an RMB 1,950,000,000 government concessional loan (GCL) agreement and a $405.8 million preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) agreement for the Multi-Lane Road Tunnel under River Karnaphuli Project. The GCL carries the following borrowing terms: a 2% interest rate, a 20-year maturity, a grace period of 5 years, and a 0.2% commitment fee. The PBC carries the following terms: a 2% interest rate, a 20-year maturity, a grace period of 5 years, and a 0.2% commitment fee. Project ID#55046 captures the GCL, while Project ID#38342 captures the PBC. The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the GCL and the PBC to finance a commercial contract between the Government of Bangladesh’s Ministry of Road Transport and Bridges and China Communication Construction Company (CCCC), which was signed in June 2015. The GCL had disbursed RMB 936,1890,000 as of June 30, 2018, RMB 1,557,869,000 as of June 30, 2019, RMB 1,950,000,000 as of June 30, 2020, and RMB 1,950,000,000 as of June 30, 2021. No repayments on the GCL had been made as of June 30, 2019 or June 30, 2021. As of June 30, 2021, the PBC had disbursed $165.559 million and no repayments had been made.   The purpose of the project, which is also known as the Multilane Karnaphuli Tunnel Project, is to construct a 3.4-kilometer-long, 10 meter-wide tunnel under the Karnaphuli River near the Port of Chittagong. The total length of the proposed tunnel will be around 9.092 kilometers, including a 3.40-kilometer tunnel under the Karnaphuli River with an approach road of 4.89 kilometers alongside 740 meters of bridges linking the main port city, and western side of the Karnaphuli along with the eastern side of the river. Upon completion, the tunnel will connect the port of Chittagong to the industrial area of the city and thereby relieve pressure on the three existing bridges. The total area of the project is 382.03 acres. More than 360.64 acres of land were acquired for the construction of roads and installments of utility lines.  A total of 2,275 families are affected by this project, and 1,660 were given compensation. China Communication Construction Company (CCCC) is the general (EPC) contractor responsible for project implementation. On November 24, 2015, the Executive Committee of the National Economic Council (Ecnec) approved the Multi-Lane Road Tunnel under River Karnaphuli Project. Construction began on February 24, 2017.  Two years later, the Prime Minister of Bangladesh officially inaugurated boring works on the tunnel on February 24, 2019. The project had achieved a 40% physical completion rate by May 2019, including the installation of over 150 meters of the first tunnel and much of the above-ground works. Then, on July 31, 2020, the project reached a key milestone with the completion of the first underwater, after a made-in-China super-diameter slurry-pressure-balance tunnel boring machine (TBM) broke through at the Karnaphuli River east bank working shaft.    The TBM, which is 94 meters long and weighs more than 2,200 tons, was developed by the Tianhe Mechanical Equipment Manufacturing Co. It was the first super-diameter slurry-pressure-balance TBM to be self-developed and exported by China. The TBM uses several self-developed technologies, such as an automatic mud water circulation system. As of October 2021, all boring-related work was completed — after the excavation of the second tube (from Anwara end of Chittagong to Patenga end) of the 3.315-km tunnel) — and the project had achieved a 73% physical completion rate. By November 2021, the project had achieved a 77.5% physical completion rate. On May 8, 2022, Harunur Rashid Chowdhury, Project Director of Karnaphuli Multilane Road Tunnel, sent a letter to the Bangladesh Bridge Authority (BBA). In it, he noted that Shanghai Port had remained closed since March 2022 due to Covid-19 and the Chinese Government’s zero-tolerance policy had affected project’s progress: ‘It may be noted that […] most of the goods and equipment are being manufactured/procured from Shanghai. Therefore, the closure of the Shanghai Port is causing a delay in shipments. […] The goods and equipment planned to arrive in March [2022] are still not able to reach Chittagong Port to date. Subsequent shipments will also get affected on this account.’ In the letter, Harunur Rashid Chowdhury also asked the BBA to take up the issue with the Economic Relations Division (ERD) and arrange an extension of the China Eximbank loan availability period by six months until May 6, 2023. On May 7, 2022, Li Zheng, the CCCC Project Manager of the Karnaphuli Tunnel Project Site Office, acknowledged in a letter to Harunur Rashid Chowdhury that the delay in shipments from Shanghai was the result of China’s ‘zero Covid’ measures. Then, in June 2022, BBA announced that two sub-contractors hired CCCC to complete two project components — a management software system for BBA and the service area (east) — had violated their contractual obligations. According to a letter from Harunur Rashid Chowdhury, Project Director of Karnaphuli Multilane Road Tunnel, to the BBA, ‘CCCC was instructed to undertake this work, but they employed sub-contractors to do so.  CCCC selected these sub-contractors and is responsible for any default of the sub-contractors. […] Unfortunately, CCCC has not effectively monitored or exercised control over both these sub-contractors.’ The Multi-Lane Road Tunnel under River Karnaphuli Project was originally expected to reach completion by the end of 2020. However, in 2018, the project’s expected completion date was pushed back to December 4, 2022.    Upon completion, the underwater tunnel is expected to reduce the time it takes to drive from Hittagong Shah Amanat International Airport to the Hittagong industrial park from four hours to 20 minutes.
staff_comments: 1. This project is a part of the Belt and Road Initiative and one of a series of loans captured via Umbrella Project ID#52873. 2. Karnaphuli is sometimes also spelled as ‘Karnafuli’. 3. This project is also known as the Karnaphuli River Tunnel Project and the Karnaphuli Multilane Road Tunnel Project. The Chinese project title is 孟加拉国卡纳普里河底隧道项目. 4. The Government of Bangladesh’s loan identification number for the GCL is L1120161014C. The Government of Bangladesh’s loan identification number for the PBC is B1120161014A.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China Eximbank provides $405.8 million preferential buyer’s credit for Multi Lane Road Tunnel under River Karnaphuli Project (Linked to Project ID #52873 and #55046) [BRI]

# Description
On June 9, 2014, the Prime Minister of Bangladesh, Sheikh Hasina, visited China and the Chinese Government and the Government of Bangladesh signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) on the Multi-Lane Road Tunnel under River Karnaphuli Project. The TBM uses several self-developed technologies, such as an automatic mud water circulation system. By November 2021, the project had achieved a 77.5% physical completion rate. On May 8, 2022, Harunur Rashid Chowdhury, Project Director of Karnaphuli Multilane Road Tunnel, sent a letter to the Bangladesh Bridge Authority (BBA). In it, he noted that Shanghai Port had remained closed since March 2022 due to Covid-19 and the Chinese Government’s zero-tolerance policy had affected project’s progress: ‘It may be noted that […] most of the goods and equipment are being manufactured/procured from Shanghai. Therefore, the closure of the Shanghai Port is causing a delay in shipments. […] The goods and equipment planned to arrive in March [2022] are still not able to reach Chittagong Port to date. Subsequent shipments will also get affected on this account.’ In the letter, Harunur Rashid Chowdhury also asked the BBA to take up the issue with the Economic Relations Division (ERD) and arrange an extension of the China Eximbank loan availability period by six months until May 6, 2023. On May 7, 2022, Li Zheng, the CCCC Project Manager of the Karnaphuli Tunnel Project Site Office, acknowledged in a letter to Harunur Rashid Chowdhury that the delay in shipments from Shanghai was the result of China’s ‘zero Covid’ measures. Then, in June 2022, BBA announced that two sub-contractors hired CCCC to complete two project components — a management software system for BBA and the service area (east) — had violated their contractual obligations. According to a letter from Harunur Rashid Chowdhury, Project Director of Karnaphuli Multilane Road Tunnel, to the BBA, ‘CCCC was instructed to undertake this work, but they employed sub-contractors to do so.  CCCC selected these sub-contractors and is responsible for any default of the sub-contractors. […] Unfortunately, CCCC has not effectively monitored or exercised control over both these sub-contractors.’ The Multi-Lane Road Tunnel under River Karnaphuli Project was originally expected to reach completion by the end of 2020. justification: The project is primarily focused on transportation infrastructure development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of a 3.4-kilometer-long road tunnel under the Karnaphuli River with approach roads and bridges, aimed at improving transportation efficiency
